subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Today with Frank Box 31
author: Lisby
full_text:
I've just been so darned busy. :( I'm trying to get all kinds of  
stuff written so that I can take my annual camping vacation in July  
and actually be away from the magazine for 2 whole weeks. But I was  
really intrigued by what happened the other day. I think Nick and I  
are going to give a go again today, since he's now out of school. But  
I can say that 31 seems to like us as adoptive family. ;)

Don't think I've forgotten about you, buddy. Not happening.

Ann

On Jun 15, 2008, at 11:54 PM, purplespacefriend wrote:

> Thanks Ann! I know some were beginng to wonder why nothing on 31.
>
> Frank-S
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
> >
> > Sorry to have been so out of the loop. I've had loads of articles
> > due. Rosemary Guiley and I also almost died of heatstroke at a
> show
> > we were both working last weekend. It was over 100 at 10 am. I
> told
> > her I was sorry to meet her looking so disreputable, but
> > circumstances were what they were... Anyway, Rosemary, let's try
> to
> > meet up in more civilized circs soon. :)
> >
> > Anyway, Frank gifted me box 31 about a month and half ago, and it
> has
> > only been this week that my son and I have been able to A.) Get
> all
> > 18 batteries in the right direction without any falling out ;) ,
> B.)
> > Sit down and see if we could make the connection. Yesterday got it
> > rolling, but first he had to turn on his RS hack and tell them
> about
> > box 31 and that he wanted them to try it. He says almost
> immediately
> > he began hearing Frank's name and "purple" through 31.
> >
> > Frank, I don't know what you do, but I swear it's like a baby
> taking
> > its first breath or something--the "reflex" of the box seems to be
> to
> > call for you. Even my mini did, remember?
> >
> > So, we just did a session today. We didn't record it, because we
> > didn't figure we'd get much and would fooling about with where to
> > hang the antenna wire and all. But, sure enough, within minutes,
> we
> > were getting responses to our simple questions, hearing the tech
> > words I have become used to, such as "check," the technician Stu
> said
> > his name, someone called my name, and when I asked if we should
> sign
> > off, someone clearly said, "Yes." I said "Thank you," and the
> > immediate response was, "You're welcome."
> >
> > 31 is very different to my mini--I can see that already. Nick and
> I
> > will keep you posted about our next round of contact.
> >
> >
> > Ann
> >
>
>
>
